apps.name: 360_Video_Viewer
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Renders 360-degree video onto an inverted sphere mesh, allowing users to stand on a central platform and view immersive looping video content. Creates a video node mapped to the sphere's geometry with 2:1 aspect ratio and plays it automatically on the client. Supports m3u8 streams.

apps.name: 360Player_Mono
apps.author: MetaRick
apps.description: Renders a 360-degree mono video onto a sphere mesh, mapping the video texture with 16:9 aspect ratio and looping playback. Supports uploading a video file or pasting a URL link via configurable props. Plays the video skybox on the client side.

apps.name: ActionBar_Saori
apps.author: Saori
apps.description: Renders an action bar UI overlay that displays interactive buttons or ability slots, allowing players to trigger actions. Confirmed as a "nice action bar" by community feedback, suggesting a functional HUD-style toolbar element.

apps.name: Alien_Planet
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Scene app that renders an alien planet environment by configuring a sky node with a custom texture, HDR lighting, adjustable sun direction/intensity via elevation and horizontal rotation, and tinted fog with configurable near/far distances and cyan fog color.

apps.name: AlleySign
apps.author: MetaRick
apps.description: Loads an alley sign GLB model and rotates it continuously around its Y-axis at a configurable speed using the per-frame update loop, creating a slow spinning sign effect without triggering any embedded GLB animations.

apps.name: aloe.glb
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Clones an Aloe Vera 3D model and distributes instances randomly across a configurable area. Users set clone count, area width/depth, and min/max scale via a UI panel, spawning a procedural plant field in the environment.

apps.name: Aloe_vera
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Demonstrates simple mesh instancing by cloning an aloe vera 3D model and placing instances in a scene. Serves as a minimal example showing how to duplicate and position GLB-based nodes within the Hyperfy app hierarchy.

apps.name: Altman_Rat
apps.author: MetaRick
apps.description: Renders a 3D rat model generated by ChatGPT o3, designed to animate scurrying movement behavior. Created as an AI-generated NPC companion piece alongside a Grok-based counterpart for comparing AI code generation approaches.

apps.name: Amanita
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns up to 500 clones of an amanita mushroom 3D model scattered randomly across a configurable rectangular area. Randomizes position, Y-axis rotation, and uniform scale for each clone, creating a particle-like ground cover system suitable for mushrooms or grass.

apps.name: AnimatedNPCMANNEQUINACTOR
apps.author: ~/drdoge.eth
apps.description: Renders a mannequin NPC actor that plays animations on a VRM avatar model. Users can swap the mannequin 3D model with any VRM and load custom animation GLBs via a config panel to test emotes and character animations.

apps.name: anybox
apps.author: ash
apps.description: A reusable container box that plays a configurable looping audio file as non-spatial background music and renders a floating UI label reading 'Background Audio' above the 3D model. Designed as an organizational shell for logic-based apps.

apps.name: app_1
apps.author: HypPrivakos - HyperWorld.Host
apps.description: Eliza AI agent integration for Hyperfy that spawns an NPC capable of interacting with players in-world. Discord context suggests it connects to the Eliza framework and communicates via networked events within the virtual environment.

props.name: Eliza
props.context: DO NOT RESPOND TO OTHER AGENTS

apps.name: app_2
apps.author: HypPrivakos - HyperWorld.Host
apps.description: Shared agent connector app that links an external Eliza-based NPC agent endpoint to a Hyperfy world, routing messages between the server and a remote URL for AI-driven interaction.

props.name: Eliza
props.context: DO NOT RESPOND TO OTHER AGENTS

apps.name: ArrayVectorProps
apps.author: ~/MayD524/Hyperfy
apps.description: Demonstrates custom array and vector3 prop types by configuring arrayFile, arrayNumber, arrayRange, and vector3 properties via app.configure(), then logs each prop value on the client. Requires the Bitmato ArrayProps mod to render extended prop UI controls on a 3D model.

apps.name: Attachable
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Networked attachable object that players can grab and pick up, syncing its state across clients. Attaches a 3D model to the player and supports drop interactions, with potential for offset position and rotation adjustments.

apps.name: Auto_Assigned_Persistent_Avatar_Station
apps.author: peezy
apps.description: Avatar station that automatically assigns a random avatar from a predefined set to each new player on first login. Persists avatar selections across sessions using the world storage API, replacing the default Hyperfy bot appearance for newcomers.

apps.name: Autonomous_Resource_Network
apps.author: MetaMike
apps.description: Spawns an autonomous resource network with configurable node types such as mine, refinery, and storage buildings. Players interact with resource nodes to gather and process materials, forming MMO-style economy fundamentals in a multiplayer world.

apps.name: Avatar_Station
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Displays a VRM avatar on a pedestal with optional hover and rotate animations, a nametag label, and an interaction action that triggers setSessionAvatar to equip the displayed avatar onto the player's session.

apps.name: Avatar_Station1
apps.author: peezy
apps.description: Avatar swap station that allows players to interact with a 3D model station and switch their avatar. Shared as a working fix for a broken avatar swap app, this triggers an avatar change upon player interaction.

apps.name: Avatar_Station_-_fixed
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Avatar station that allows players to interact with a kiosk to swap or customize their avatar model. Uses JSON-based synchronous storage to persist avatar selections across sessions.

apps.name: Avatar_Station_4
apps.author: MetaRick
apps.description: Avatar station that renders a 3D model serving as an interactive kiosk where players can browse and swap avatars. Likely triggers avatar changes on interaction with the station object in the world.

apps.name: Avatar_StationSCALE
apps.author: ~/drdoge.eth
apps.description: Avatar station that scales equipped avatar models, attempting to modify mesh scale properties without requiring core-level integration. Renders a 3D model station where players interact to adjust their avatar dimensions and persist the scaled version.

apps.name: BasicMp3Player
apps.author: Valiant
apps.description: Minimal clickable MP3 player that plays and pauses an audio node when the user clicks a GLB cube mesh. Supports uploaded files or pasted URLs, with configurable volume, loop, spatial/global mode, and auto-play on upload.

apps.name: Bats_v1
apps.author: Valiant
apps.description: Spawns a configurable swarm of up to 5000 bat clones by cloning wing meshes from a GLB model, then animates wing-flapping and erratic flight paths each frame. Plays a looping spatial audio loop for the swarm sound, with toggleable settings for bat count, scale, wingbeat speed, and fly speed.

apps.name: beacon
apps.author: m₂
apps.description: Registers a Hyperfy world on the Zesty relay directory by collecting user-configured fields and submitting world metadata. Drop the beacon into a world, fill out the listing properties, and the world appears on relay.zesty.xyz alongside other spatial apps.

apps.name: beacon-dev
apps.author: m₂
apps.description: Development beacon app that defines configurable parameters (props) for in-world placement. Shared as a debug test to troubleshoot missing UI parameter fields, likely renders a 3D model with custom property tags in the editor panel.

apps.name: bending_leaf_V1
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Loads a skinned-mesh leaf 3D model and plays a looping 'bend' animation on its rig. A minimal environment decoration that animates a leaf bending motion using the built-in GLB skeletal animation system.

apps.name: BIKE-fallout
apps.author: ~/drdoge.eth
apps.description: Renders a rideable bike with a Fallout-themed 3D model and colliders, allowing players to mount and drive the vehicle through the world without being thrown off by physics interactions.

apps.name: BIKE-fallout2
apps.author: ~/drdoge.eth
apps.description: Spawns a rideable Fallout-themed bike vehicle with a box collider for terrain traversal. Handles physics-based movement across uneven terrain with minimal bouncing, and supports configurable collider sizing for different world environments.

apps.name: BlockTesting
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Captures right mouse button input to trigger a blocking emote on the local player via applyEffect, applying a snare and looping sword-block animation. Releases the effect on button release using applyEffect(null). Created as a bug report testing effect cancellation behavior.

apps.name: BloomBlock
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Renders a bloom-styled decorative block as a 3D model in the world. The name suggests it applies a visual bloom or emissive glow effect to a block object, likely leveraging emission materials for environmental decoration.

apps.name: Book_-_Flip
apps.author: Dhin
apps.description: Spawns a procedural book object from box primitives with static physics colliders. Pressing F triggers a flip emote and pushes the player upward and forward based on camera direction, functioning as a double-jump launcher.

props.prompt: a closed book standing up vertically

apps.name: Boombox
apps.author: Dhin
apps.description: Renders an old-school boombox built from primitive shapes (speakers, cassette deck, knobs, antenna) and plays looping spatial audio with configurable volume, distance, and rolloff. A clickable play/pause button syncs playback state between server and clients, toggling an emissive LED indicator.

apps.name: broke-rom
apps.author: general hyper
apps.description: Renders a configurable 3D ROM cartridge model and shifts texture UV coordinates on the mesh material to display a selected color variant (Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, Violet) via a dropdown prop. Created as a bug-report test case for material unlinking behavior.

apps.name: Builder_Drone
apps.author: devbyte
apps.description: Spawns a flyable builder drone with a configurable keybind that players hold to take control. Animates spinning rotors, syncs kinematic rigidbody position and quaternion across clients, and overrides the camera to a first-person drone view for building in flight mode.

apps.name: Builder_Drone_X501
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Multiplayer flyable drone with four spinning rotors that a player triggers via an action prompt. Captures WASD + mouse controls to steer a kinematic rigidbody through the world, syncs position and quaternion state across server and clients, and attaches the camera to the drone view node. Releases co

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V1
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns a swarm of 50 butterfly 3D models by cloning wing nodes, then animates each butterfly with randomized sinusoidal wing-flapping rotation and gentle vertical floating movement on every update tick. Scale, flap speed, and position are randomized per instance.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V2a
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns a swarm of 100 butterfly clones with randomized scale, position, and flap speed. Animates wing flapping and sinusoidal drifting movement each frame using the update loop, creating an organic floating butterfly swarm from a single GLB model.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V3
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns a configurable swarm of up to 5000 butterfly clones from a GLB wing model, then animates each butterfly with randomized sine-wave flapping, oscillatory flight paths, and drift offsets. A UI panel exposes controls for butterfly amount, scale range, flap speed, and fly speed.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V4
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns a configurable swarm of up to 5000 butterfly clones from a GLB model and animates their wing flapping and oscillatory flight paths using sine-wave motion on each frame update. A UI panel exposes controls for butterfly count, scale range, flap speed, and fly speed.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V5
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns up to 5000 butterfly clones from a GLB wing model and animates their wing flapping, sinusoidal flight paths, and drift movement each frame. Configurable scale, flap speed, fly speed, and swarm count via UI panel. Butterflies are clamped above ground level.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V6
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns up to 5000 butterfly clones from a GLB wing model and animates their wing-flapping and drifting flight paths each frame. A configurable UI panel controls spawn area, height, amount, scale range, flap-speed, and fly-speed for the swarm.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V6_Hyperfly_edition
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns up to 5000 butterfly clones from a GLB wing model, animates wing flapping and sinusoidal drift movement per frame. Configurable UI controls spawn area, height, scale range, flap speed, and fly speed for the swarm.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V6_Hyperfly_edition2
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns up to 5000 butterfly clones with emissive cyan wings across a configurable 3D area. Animates wing flapping and sinusoidal drift movement per frame. Each butterfly receives randomized scale, flap speed, fly speed, and rotation from a GLB model.

apps.name: Butterfly_Swarm_V6_Hyperfly_edition2_BW
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Spawns up to 5000 butterfly clones with randomized scale, flap speed, and fly speed across a configurable 3D area. Animates wing flapping and drifting movement each frame using cloned GLB wing nodes with emissive materials in a black-and-white edition.

apps.name: ButterflyFlight
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Renders a single butterfly 3D model and animates its flight path procedurally, simulating natural wing movement and wandering behavior in the scene. Designed as a reusable nature element for virtual environments.

apps.name: ButtonsUI
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders interactive UI buttons using onPointer events and uiViews, plays click sound effects, tracks a click counter, and toggles between world-space and screen-space display modes with scalable preset themes.
apps.script_excerpt:
/**  
 * Interactive UI Buttons Example with Hover Effects  
 *   
 * This app demonstrates how to create interactive UI buttons in Hyperfy using:  
 * - UIView elements as clickable button containers  
 * - onPointerDown, onPointerEnter, and onPointerLeave event handlers  
 * - Dynamic styling and hover effects  
 * - Button feedback with visual changes  
 * - Multiple button types and layouts  
 * - Props configuration organized with sections  
 * - Audio file configuration for sound effects  
 * - Responsive UI sizing based on button size  
 * - Cursor pointer for screen space UI  
 *   
 * Key concepts:  
 * - UIView elements can act as buttons with pointer event handlers  
 * - Hover effects enhance user experience  
 * - Visual feedback provides immediate response  
 * - State management tracks button interactions  
 * - 3D mesh visibility can be controlled through props  
 */  
  
// Configure app properties organized by sections  
app.configure([  
  {  
    type: 'section',  
    label: 'Appearance'  
  },  
  {  
    key: 'buttonTheme',  
    type: 'switch',  
    label: 'Button Theme',  
    hint: 'Choose the visual style for the buttons',  
    options: [  
      { label: 'Modern', value: 'modern' },  
      { label: 'Classic', value: 'classic' },  
      { label: 'Neon', value: 'neon' }  
    ],  
    initial: 'modern'  
  },  
  {  
    key: 'buttonSize',  
    type: 'range',  
    label: 'Button Size',  
    hint: 'Adjust the size of the buttons and UI container',  
    min: 0.5,  
    max: 2.0,  
    step: 0.1,  
    initial: 1.0  
  },  
  {  
    type: 'section',  
    label: 'Behavior'  
  },  
  {  
    key: 'enableSounds',  
    type: 'toggle',  
    label: 'Button Sounds',  
    hint: 'Play sound effects when buttons are clicked',  
    initial: true  
  },  
  {  
    key: 'clickSound',  
    type: 'file',  
    kind: 'audio',  
    label: 'Click Sound',  
    hint: 'Audio file to play when buttons are clicked'  
  },

apps.name: cam_raycast_action_bar
apps.author: Saori
apps.description: Renders a 10-slot action bar UI anchored to the screen bottom with icon images and keybind labels. Triggers a camera-based raycast on key press (Q) by reading camera quaternion, computing a forward direction, and sending the ray origin/direction to the server via networked events.

apps.name: Camera_Trigger
apps.author: Dhin
apps.description: Creates a semi-transparent trigger zone that detects when the local player enters and smoothly lerps the camera to a fixed overlook position using quaternion slerp. On exit, the camera transitions back to player eye level and releases control. Ideal for museum-style cinematic viewpoints.

apps.name: CameraLaser
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Equippable laser gun that shoots red laser beams from the camera's forward direction. Players trigger an action to equip, then fire lasers on mouse click. Laser clones spawn via networked events, fade out over 3 seconds, and are cleaned up by the server.

apps.name: CameraManager
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Reusable camera management system that controls follow, static, orbit, and shake modes with smooth damped transitions. Listens for world events like camera:follow and camera:shake to switch states, and animates the camera position and rotation each frame using configurable damping and lerp factors.

apps.name: CameraManagerFreecamToggle
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Toggles a free camera mode on and off, allowing mouse-look rotation without holding right-click and adjusting move speed via mouse scroll. Manages camera state transitions for smooth freecam navigation in a Hyperfy world.

apps.name: CameraManagerTest
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Test rig that spawns animated cubes (orbiting, bouncing, figure-8) and cycles through camera modes (follow, orbit, static, default) via keyboard input. Emits camera:follow, camera:orbit, camera:shake, and camera:reset events. Renders a screen-space UI panel displaying the active mode and target cube

apps.author: ash

apps.script_excerpt:
export default function main(world, app, fetch, props, setTimeout) {
app.configure([
  {
    key: 'videoFile',
    type: 'file',
    kind: 'video',
    label: 'Video File',
    hint: 'An mp4 video file to be played.'
  },
  {
    key: 'videoUrl',
    type: 'text',
    label: 'Video URL',
    placeholder: '.m3u8',
    hint: 'The URL to an HLS (m3u8) video manifest.'
  },
  {
    key: 'target',
    type: 'text',
    label: 'Target',
    hint: 'The name of the object/mesh to display the video on.',
  },
  
  {
    key: 'aspect',
    type: 'text',
    label: 'Aspect Ratio',
    hint: `The physical/visual aspect ratio of your target mesh. The UVs of your target mesh should generally always cover the entire UV space, and then use the 'Fit' property below to control how videos fit onto it.` ,
  },
  {
    key: 'fit',
    type: 'switch',
    label: 'Fit',
    options: [
      { label: 'None', value: 'none' },
      { label: 'Cover', value: 'cover' },
      { label: 'Contain', value: 'contain' },
    ],
    hint: `The strategy used to fit the video onto the target mesh, based on the videos actual aspect ratio vs the target mesh. 'None' will stretch to fit the target mesh UVs. 'Cover' will scale the video up to cover the entire UV space while maintaining its aspect ratio. 'Contain' will scale the video so that it all fits inside the UV space, also while maintaining its aspect ratio.`
  },
  {
    key: 'loop',
    type: 'toggle',
    label: 'Loop',
    hint: 'Whether the video should start again once it reaches the end.'
  },
])

const src =  props.videoFile?.url || props.videoUrl
const target = props.target
const [aWidth, aHeight] = props.aspect.split(':')
const aspect = aWidth / aHeight 
const fit = props.fit
const loop = props.loop

if (world.isClient) {
  const mesh = app.get(target)
  const video = app.create('video', {
    src,
    geometry: mesh.geometry,
    linked: true,
    loop,
    aspect,
    fit,
    doubleside: true,
    castShadow: true,
    receiveShadow: true

apps.script_excerpt:
/**  
 * Hyperfy UI System Example  
 *   
 * This app demonstrates the core UI system in Hyperfy, showcasing:  
 * - Creating UI containers with world/screen space positioning  
 * - Using UIView for flexbox layout containers  
 * - Adding UIText and UIImage elements with styling  
 * - Configuring props with various field types including toggles  
 * - Applying borders, spacing, and responsive design  
 * - Dynamic positioning and space switching  
 * - Proper UI hierarchy (UI -> UIView -> UIText/UIImage)  
 * - Block visibility control using app.get() and node.active  
 *   
 * Key concepts:  
 * - Always use app.add() to attach UI to the world  
 * - UI elements must be children of a UI container  
 * - Props allow non-technical users to configure the app  
 * - Flexbox layout works similar to CSS  
 */  
  
// Configure app properties with hints for user guidance

  {  
    key: 'welcomeText',

apps.name: hyperball
apps.author: Saori
apps.description: Hyperball is a ball-based interactive game object that spawns a physics-driven ball players can kick or throw within a Hyperfy world. Shared as a community asset, it renders a 3D model and syncs ball state across networked sessions for multiplayer play.

apps.name: HyperBeacon
apps.author: hypShaman
apps.description: Registers a Hyperfy world on a Zesty Relay by sending a PUT beacon signal with configurable name, description, image, and tags. Animates a rotating 3D model and ring mesh once fields are set, and sends periodic heartbeat POST requests to keep the session alive.

apps.name: HyperBeacon_v2
apps.author: maximus
apps.description: Beacon app that registers a world with a Zesty DSIG relay server via PUT request and sends periodic session heartbeat signals every 4.5 seconds. Animates a rotating 3D model (ring and hyper mesh) on each frame update using client-side rotation logic.

apps.name: HyperBoardV1
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Spawns a rideable hyperboard vehicle that players can mount and ride. Dropping loot or health items triggers the ability to ride the board, combining interaction mechanics with vehicle movement across the world.

apps.name: HyperCloud
apps.author: ash
apps.description: HyperCloud app shared by ash requiring the latest dev build. Based on surrounding discussion about multiplayer smoothing and avatar movement, it likely renders a cloud-themed 3D model or environment element within a Hyperfy world scene.

apps.name: hyperducksitfighter
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders a duck-themed sit fighter 3D model with a sitting animation, allowing players to mount and ride the duck. Uses a Mixamo-style pose where the avatar grasps and holds on to the vehicle.

apps.name: HyperFridge
apps.author: hypShaman
apps.description: Renders a 3D fridge model as an interactive environment prop. Based on the app name and context, it likely displays a placeable refrigerator object that users can interact with in a Hyperfy world scene.

apps.name: HyperFridge_1
apps.author: ash
apps.description: A fridge 3D model with an interactive door that triggers an open/close action when a player interacts with it. Renders a fridge object and animates the door node in response to user input.

apps.name: HyperPortal
apps.author: hypShaman
apps.description: Portal app that teleports players to configurable XYZ coordinates when they enter a trigger collider zone. Parses comma-separated coordinate props and calls player.teleport to warp avatars to the destination, using a custom GLB portal model.

apps.name: HyperPortal_-_fixed
apps.author: Agent12
apps.description: HyperPortal app that teleports players to another world or location when they interact with a portal object. Based on community discussion around portal tinkering, this fixed version renders a portal trigger zone and transports avatars on contact.

apps.name: HyperPortal_1
apps.author: MetaRick
apps.description: Portal app named HyperPortal that teleports players to another destination when they interact with or enter a trigger zone. Based on the app name and context praising it as huge and epic, it likely renders a 3D portal model in the world.

apps.name: HyperPortal_with_Set
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Portal trigger zone that teleports players to a configurable destination. Admins click a 'Set' button in the UI to store their current position on the server, and any player entering the portal collider is teleported to that saved location via networked position sync.

apps.name: HyperPortal_with_Set_Manual
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Portal trigger zone that teleports players to a configurable destination. Admins switch between 'Set' mode (captures current player position) or 'Manual' mode (enters X/Y/Z coordinates). Syncs the target position from server to all clients via networked events.

apps.name: HyperSpeaker
apps.author: hypShaman
apps.description: Speaker model that attempts to drive emissive intensity from audio input, aiming for audio-reactive visual effects on a 3D speaker object. Author notes curve-based mapping is under exploration for linking audio levels to material glow.

apps.name: Icons2_1
apps.author: peezy
apps.description: Renders a library of 500 selectable 3D icons that users pick from a dropdown UI. Displays the chosen icon model in the scene, serving as a reusable visual asset pack for world-building and UI decoration.

apps.name: Model-VCA
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Loads a 3D model with configurable visibility, collision, and animation properties. Toggles mesh visibility on demand and reads mesh data via app.configure to dynamically expose editable fields for in-world customization of the model display.

apps.name: Model_-_animation
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Extends the default model app by adding a configurable animation field, allowing users to load a 3D model and trigger or play a specified animation clip directly from the app properties panel.

apps.name: monkey_head
apps.author: hypShaman
apps.description: Renders a monkey head 3D model with a jump button texture and configurable jumpHeight prop. The script is empty, serving as a minimal scaffold for rigidbody and physics experimentation discussed in developer context.
apps.script_excerpt:
export default function main(world, app, fetch, props, setTimeout) {

}

apps.name: MoonJump
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Tracks player grounded state via raycasts and automatically pushes players upward with a double-jump force vector when they become airborne, resetting the state upon landing. Loads a small GLB collider model as the app base.

apps.name: n1-n1-05
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Loads a GLB 3D model and sets its collider to trimesh mode by disabling convex, enabling precise collision detection against the model's actual geometry rather than a simplified convex hull.

apps.name: NavMesh
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Generates a navigation mesh at runtime and drives an AI agent using A* pathfinding across the computed grid. The agent navigates obstacles autonomously, demonstrating procedural navmesh construction and graph-based path traversal within a Hyperfy world.

apps.name: NEON_1
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Renders customizable neon sign text by cloning 3D letter meshes from a GLB model and positioning them with configurable spacing, scale, height, alignment, glow intensity, and color. Supports A-Z, 0-9, and special characters via a UI configuration panel.

apps.name: NEON_2
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Renders a customizable neon sign by cloning 3D letter meshes from a GLB model based on user-typed text input. Supports configurable spacing, scale, height, glow intensity, color, and alignment. Plays looping spatial audio with adjustable volume, distance, and rolloff settings via a UI panel.

apps.name: Networked_Grabbable
apps.author: Saori
apps.description: Networked grabbable object that players can pick up via an action trigger and attach to their right hand bone. Syncs ownership state across server and clients using app.send events. Press X to drop the item, restoring the pickup action for other players.

apps.name: Notifications
apps.author: Lastraum - theforgecore.xyz
apps.description: Renders a screen-space UI notification panel that animates slide-in/slide-out. Listens for world events via a configurable message key and queues incoming messages with optional color, fontSize, and timer. apps.name: NPC
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Spawns a VRM avatar as a kinematic NPC with idle, walk, run, and talk emote animations. Triggers attack sequences with cooldown timers, calculates hit positions using forward direction vectors, and emits combat events. Supports bone transform queries for weapon attachment on the right hand.

apps.name: NPC_10
apps.author: peezy
apps.description: VRM-based NPC that detects players within a configurable FOV and range, chases them using walk/run animations, and triggers melee attack combos with hit detection via rigidbody colliders. Plays raptor audio on attack and syncs animation state across clients through networked events.

apps.name: NPC_9
apps.author: peezy
apps.description: VRM-based NPC that animates idle, walk, run, and sit emotes, detects players within a configurable FOV and range, chases them, and triggers randomized attack animations with cooldown-based hit detection. Plays spatial raptor audio and emits networked npc:attack events with calculated hit positions.

apps.name: NPC_Prisoner
apps.author: b34k3r
apps.description: Spawns a prisoner NPC with a VRM avatar that autonomously walks, idles, and talks using emote animations. A physics controller moves the character with gravity, pseudo-random direction changes, and smooth quaternion slerp rotation to face the current heading.

apps.name: ObjectDistribution
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Distributes 3D model instances across a tagged terrain surface, scattering objects like trees by referencing a named template and terrain tag to procedurally populate environments with placed assets.

apps.name: Omka-2-21-uiBillboard_-_proximity_trigger
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Displays a UI billboard element that triggers based on player proximity. When a player enters the trigger zone, the billboard becomes visible, enabling contextual UI overlays in a 3D scene.

apps.name: ParticleFun
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Spawns and renders particle effects using mesh-based auto-instancing. Demonstrates particle system configurations within the Hyperfy environment, with billboard mode noted as partially broken during development.

apps.name: PAY_TO_ENTER_DOOR
apps.author: peezy
apps.description: Animated door that triggers open after a Solana SPL token payment. Supports sliding and swinging modes with configurable direction, distance, and swing angle. Displays a billboard UI panel showing the token price, checks the player's wallet balance, and auto-closes after a timer.

apps.name: Physics_-_Contacts__Tags
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Demo that assigns tags to two rigidbody objects (Blue and Red) and triggers onContactStart/onContactEnd callbacks to detect collisions, then renders billboard UI text labels above each object displaying which tagged body is currently touching.

apps.name: Physics_-_Raycast_Tags
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Demonstrates physics raycasting with tag-based identification. Fires a raycast from a laser node each frame and renders the hit rigidbody's tag (e.g. 'BLUE') on a billboard UI text label. Sets up a dynamic rigidbody with a convex collider, supporting cross-app raycast detection.

apps.name: Physics_-_Triggers__Tags
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Demonstrates rigidbody trigger zones and tags by assigning a static blue body with a trigger collider and a dynamic red body with a convex collider. Detects onTriggerEnter and onTriggerLeave events, then renders a billboard UI text label displaying which tagged object is currently inside the trigger

apps.name: PingScript4CompanionNEW
apps.author: ~/drdoge.eth
apps.description: Spawns a companion NPC that follows the player around the world. Users can swap 3D models to customize the follower entity. Shared for community experimentation with simple pathfinding and model-based companion behavior.

props.name: Train
props.description: A scannable object in the world

apps.name: PingScriptFORcompanion
apps.author: ~/drdoge.eth
apps.description: Listens for ping events from a companion or minimap system and emits pong responses containing the object's configurable display name, type, and position. Attach this script to any world object to make it scannable and locatable by companion or HUD/compass apps.

props.name: Train
props.description: A scannable object in the world

apps.name: Plane
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Loads a 3D plane model as a Hyperfy app, allowing users to place and interact with an aircraft asset in the world. Distributed as a .hyp file and designed to work on the latest dev build of the platform.
apps.script_excerpt:
app.remove(app.get('Block'))
const plane = app.create('group')

const fuselage = app.create('prim', {
  type: 'box',
  size: [0.5, 0.5, 3],
  color: 'white',
  position: [0, 0, 0],
  physics: 'kinematic'
})

const wing = app.create('prim', {
  type: 'box',
  size: [6, 0.1, 1],
  color: 'white',
  position: [0, 0, -0.5],
  physics: 'kinematic'
})

const tail = app.create('prim', {
  type: 'box',
  size: [0.1, 1, 0.5],
  color: 'white',
  position: [0, 0.5, 1.2],
  physics: 'kinematic'
})

const propeller = app.create('prim', {
  type: 'box',
  size: [0.05, 0.05, 0.3],
  color: 'gray',
  position: [0, 0, -1.6],
  physics: 'kinematic'
})

plane.add(fuselage)
plane.add(wing)
plane.add(tail)
plane.add(propeller)

plane.position.set(0, 5, 0)

let time = 0
const radius = 10
const height = 5
const speed = 0.5

app.on('update', delta => {
  time += delta * speed
  
  plane.position.x = Math.cos(time) * radius
  plane.position.z = Math.sin(time) * radius
  plane.position.y = height + Math.sin(time * 2) * 2
  
  plane.rotation.y = time + Math.PI / 2
  plane.rotation.z = Math.sin(time * 3) * 0.2
  
  propeller.rotation.z += delta * 20
})

app.add(plane)

apps.name: Platforms
apps.author: hypShaman
apps.description: Platformer template that spawns configurable platform sizes (small to extra-large) and triggers a falling platform via an area trigger zone. When a player steps on the collider, the platform switches to dynamic physics after a configurable delay, then resets to its original position on a timer.

apps.name: Player_Projectiles
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Fires player-controlled projectiles using pointer lock input, spawning networked projectile entities on click. Includes a fix for accidental first-shoot by checking control.pointer.locked before triggering shots.

apps.name: Player_Transforms
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Renders a screenspace UI panel that reads the local player's position, body rotation (as Euler angles), and camera direction vector every frame, displaying color-coded XYZ values updated in real time via the update loop.

apps.script_excerpt:
let d, n
d = app.get('PlaneWifDiffuse')
n = app.get('PlaneWifNormal')

app.on('update', delta => {
	 d.material.textureX += 0.01 * delta
	 d.material.textureY += 0.01 * delta
	 n.material.textureY -= 0.3 * delta
	 n.material.textureX += 0.3 * delta
})

apps.description: Customizable trigger box that teleports players to a configurable X,Y,Z destination when they walk into it. Creates a rigidbody with a trigger collider on a scalable green cube mesh that can be toggled invisible to hide the zone.

apps.name: test_level
apps.author: Saori
apps.description: Renders a static 3D test level model (~3 MB GLB) as an environment scene. The script exports an empty main function, so no runtime logic executes beyond loading and displaying the level geometry.
apps.script_excerpt: export default function main(world, app, fetch, props, setTimeout) { }

apps.name: testProp2
apps.author: cru
apps.description: Renders a 3D mesh prop with a UV scroll effect that animates a seamless alpha texture on a secondary mesh layer, creating a flowing visual surface animation. Borrowed scrolling code drives continuous texture offset updates on the model.

apps.name: Text_link_option
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Renders a configurable UI text panel in world space with customizable size, color, alignment, and background. Triggers world.open to navigate to an optional URL when the user clicks the panel via onPointerDown.
apps.script_excerpt:
export default function main(world, app, fetch, props, setTimeout) {
app.configure([
    {
      key: 'text',
      type: 'textarea',
      label: 'Text',
    },
    {
      key: 'size',
      type: 'number',
      label: 'Size',
      initial: 12,
    },
    {
      key: 'color',
      type: 'text',
      label: 'Color',
      initial: 'white',
    },
    {
      key: 'align',
      type: 'switch',
      label: 'Align',
      options: [
        { label: 'Left', value: 'left' },
        { label: 'Center', value: 'center' },
        { label: 'Right', value: 'right' },
      ],
      initial: 'center',
    },
    {
      key: 'canvas',
      type: 'section',
      label: 'Canvas'
    },
    {
      key: 'width',
      type: 'number',
      label: 'Width',
      dp: 1,
      step: 1,
      bigStep: 10,
      initial: 100,
    },
    {
      key: 'height',
      type: 'number',
      label: 'Height',
      dp: 1,
      step: 1,
      bigStep: 10,
      initial: 100,
    },
    {
      key: 'bg',
      type: 'text',
      label: 'Background',
      initial: 'black',
    },
    {
      key: 'padding',
      type: 'number',
      label: 'Padding',
      initial: 10,
    },
    {
      key: 'lit',
      type: 'toggle',
      label: 'Lit',
    },
    {
      key: 'doubleside',
      type: 'toggle',
      label: 'Doubleside',
    },
    {
      key: 'link',
      type: 'text',
      label: 'Link URL',
      initial: '',
      placeholder: 'optional',
    },
  ])
  app.keepActive = true
  
  const text = props.text
  const size = props.size
  const color = props.color || 'white'
  const align = props.align
  const bg = props.bg
  const width = props.width
  const padding = props.padding
  const height = props.height
  const lit = props.lit
  const doubleside = props.doubleside
  const link = props.link
  
  const surface = app.get('Surface')
  app.remove(surface)
  
  const $ui = app.create('ui', {
    pivot: 'bottom-center',
    width,
    height,

apps.name: TImer
apps.author: MetaRick
apps.description: Renders an in-world timer display that tracks elapsed time and resets to zero each time the object is moved. Useful for timing activities within a scene by counting seconds from placement.

apps.name: TOKEN_GATE
apps.author: peezy
apps.description: Token-gated door that checks a player's Solana SPL token balance and animates a sliding or swinging door open when the minimum threshold is met. Renders UI panels displaying required token amount and live wallet balance. Requires the Solana mod for on-chain queries.

apps.name: Tornado
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Spawns a tornado-style particle system using a circular emitter with orbital and linear velocity to create a swirling upward vortex. Supports a configurable texture image prop and renders up to 10,000 particles with alpha-over-life fade curves in world space.

apps.name: TriggerZone
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Creates a configurable box collider trigger zone that detects when players walk through it and sends a Discord webhook message. Renders a semi-transparent emissive prim cube as a visual indicator with adjustable color, opacity, and size. Supports excluding specific player names from triggering.

apps.name: Trippy_Floor
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Renders a trippy animated floor 3D model with psychedelic visual effects. Discord context suggests it could be hooked into audio levels for reactive animation, indicating a decorative environment piece that animates dynamically in a Hyperfy world.

apps.name: trump-agent
apps.author: Saori
apps.description: Spawns a Trump-themed AI agent NPC that connects to an external Eliza server to handle conversational interactions with players in the world. Requires a configured Eliza endpoint URL to process and respond to chat messages.

props.name: Trump
props.context: You are standing in a large open grassy field in the middle of the day with a nice blue sky. There is almost nothing else around except the whitehouse which is behind you.

apps.name: uiBillboard_-_proximity_trigger
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders a UI billboard that triggers visibility when a player enters a proximity collider zone. Uses rigidbody onTriggerEnter to detect nearby players and displays a floating UI panel above a 3D model in the world.

apps.name: uiImage_from_File
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders a UI panel that displays an uploaded image file (jpg/png/webp) with configurable width, height, object-fit mode, and 3D position. Creates a uiview container and a uiimage node, loading the texture from a file prop and placing it on a lit, bordered panel.

apps.name: uiImage_from_File-update1
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders a configurable UI panel that displays a texture image loaded from a file asset. Creates uiview and uiimage nodes with adjustable width, height, position, object-fit mode, and border radius. Supports billboard mode and customizable color properties via app.configure range and dropdown fields.

apps.name: uiImage_from_URL
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders a UI image element sourced from an external URL or from a local file upload (jpg/png/webp). Demonstrates two basic approaches to displaying images within the Hyperfy UI layer.

apps.name: uiImageFromUrl
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders a UI image loaded from an external URL by creating a UIView and UIImage node with configurable props. Demonstrates how to display remote images inside a Hyperfy UI panel using customizable positioning and sizing parameters.

apps.name: Vanguard
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Class-based PvPvE combat character that equips a VRM avatar and sword weapon, triggers attack/charge/special emotes with damage via overlapSphere hit detection, plays combat audio, manages an energy system with regeneration, and renders a UI action bar with skill icons and health/energy bars.

apps.name: VehicleFlight
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: A flying vehicle app (Hyperduck 2.0) that enables players to pilot an airborne craft with flight controls and physics-based movement through the world environment.

enterEmote.name: Sitting In Chair Hands Resting On Thighs.glb

apps.name: vertexPaintTest
apps.author: hypShaman
apps.description: Renders a vertex-painted 3D model created with ucupaint to test vertex color attribute support in Hyperfy, intended as a lightweight background or filler object for environment decoration.

apps.name: vibe
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Spawns 20 cube nodes in a circle around the player when pressing O, animates them orbiting randomly, then shoots all cubes in the camera's forward direction on left click. Configurable cube count and behavior.

apps.name: Video_Channel_Changer
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Plays a video atlas on a target mesh and cycles through 16 UV-based channels on pointer click. Supports mp4 files or HLS streams with configurable aspect ratio, fit mode, and looping. Shifts texture UV offsets to switch the visible channel region.
apps.script_excerpt:
export default function main(world, app, fetch, props, setTimeout) {
app.configure([
  {
    key: 'videoFile',
    type: 'file',
    kind: 'video',
    label: 'Video File',
    hint: 'An mp4 video file to be played.'
  },
  {
    key: 'videoUrl',
    type: 'text',
    label: 'Video URL',
    placeholder: '.m3u8',
    hint: 'The URL to an HLS (m3u8) video manifest.'
  },
  {
    key: 'target',
    type: 'text',
    label: 'Target',
    hint: 'The name of the object/mesh to display the video on.',
  },
  
  {
    key: 'aspect',
    type: 'text',
    label: 'Aspect Ratio',
    hint: `The physical/visual aspect ratio of your target mesh. The UVs of your target mesh should generally always cover the entire UV space, and then use the 'Fit' property below to control how videos fit onto it.` ,
  },
  {
    key: 'fit',
    type: 'switch',
    label: 'Fit',
    options: [
      { label: 'None', value: 'none' },
      { label: 'Cover', value: 'cover' },
      { label: 'Contain', value: 'contain' },
    ],
    hint: `The strategy used to fit the video onto the target mesh, based on the videos actual aspect ratio vs the target mesh. 'None' will stretch to fit the target mesh UVs. 'Cover' will scale the video up to cover the entire UV space while maintaining its aspect ratio. 'Contain' will scale the video so that it all fits inside the UV space, also while maintaining its aspect ratio.`
  },
  {
    key: 'loop',
    type: 'toggle',
    label: 'Loop',
    hint: 'Whether the video should start again once it reaches the end.'
  },
])

const src =  props.videoFile?.url || props.videoUrl
const target = props.target
const [aWidth, aHeight] = props.aspect.split(':')
const aspect = aWidth / aHeight 
const fit = props.fit
const loop = props.loop

if (world.isClient) {
  const mesh = app.get(target)
  const video = app.create('video', {
    src,
    geometry: mesh.geometry,
    linked: true,
    loop,
    aspect,
    fit,
    doubleside: true,
    castShadow: true,
    receiveShadow: true

apps.name: VoiceZone
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Defines a spatial trigger zone that modifies voice chat audio levels for players when they enter or leave the zone, enabling localized voice volume control for areas like stages or guild pods.

apps.name: Wall_Hang
apps.author: Dhin
apps.description: Wall-hang mechanic that raycasts to detect ledges while the player falls, teleports them to the grab point, and applies a hanging emote effect. Players can climb up with space or drop with S key, using impulse pushes and cooldown timers to manage transitions.

apps.name: Wasteland-HUD
apps.author: ~/drdoge.eth
apps.description: Standalone wasteland HUD overlay that renders a compass, health meter, and environmental damage gauges. Deals area-of-effect damage via rad zone mechanics and syncs with PVP combat systems or operates independently alongside world effects.

apps.name: Water_Fountain
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Spawns a looping cone-shaped particle emitter that simulates a water fountain arc, applying gravity force to blue-cyan particles with configurable texture. Renders 100 particles per second in world space atop a GLB fountain model.

apps.name: WaterPlane
apps.author: Shiffty
apps.description: Renders a dynamic water surface by cloning a 20x20 grid of plane segments and animating wave height and rotation each frame. Spawns ambient spray particles, periodic fish splash bursts, and player movement trail particles at the water surface level.

apps.name: WaterPlanet
apps.author: 🆂🅴🅱🅶🅰
apps.description: A water planet 3D model created with Hyperfy Tool in Blender, intended to animate water surfaces and optionally rotate a planetary ring using per-frame update scripts that modify node rotation and position.

apps.name: WaterPlanet_fixed
apps.author: vox
apps.description: Renders a water planet 3D model with distorted UV-based surface animation that simulates realistic water movements. Shared as a fixed .hyp asset for placement in virtual environments.

apps.name: WavePanel
apps.author: cru
apps.description: Renders a wave-themed UI panel as a 3D model element in the world. Based on the app name, it likely displays or animates a wave visualization on a panel surface for decorative or informational purposes.

apps.name: Weapon_Animation_Override
apps.author: Saori
apps.description: Pickupable weapon that overrides player locomotion animations (idle, walk, run, sprint in all directions) using custom emote GLBs. Attaches the weapon model to the player's right hand bone, triggers shooting via raycasts from the camera, and syncs ownership state across server and clients.

apps.name: Weapons_Radial
apps.author: 0mka
apps.description: Renders a radial UI menu that lets players select and switch between weapons. Triggers weapon selection via pointer interaction, enabling quick combat loadout changes through a circular overlay interface.

apps.name: Weightpaint_ScreenUI_test1
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Renders a 10x10 screen-space UI grid that lets players paint squares by clicking and dragging. On mouse release, clones a flower mesh from the GLB model into world positions matching painted cells. The UI grid toggles visibility based on player proximity within 10 meters. Right-click resets the grid

apps.name: who_there
apps.author: Gert-Jan Akerboom
apps.description: Renders a screenspace UI panel displaying an online player count and toggles an expandable list of player names. Listens for enter/leave events and syncs the roster every two seconds. Highlights the local player with a colored indicator dot.

apps.name: Wolf_Maro
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Renders a skinned wolf mesh with an idle animation and plays a random animation from the rig's anim list on pointer click. Demonstrates skinned mesh support by picking a random anim with configurable speed and fade transitions.

apps.name: WorldUISpace
apps.author: ash
apps.description: Demonstrates world-space UI rendering for elements like timers, quests, GUIs, action bars, and controls. Renders UI panels anchored in 3D space, enabling interactive overlays within the Hyperfy world environment.
